Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: பற்றற்ற கண்ணும் பழைமைபா ராட்டுதல் சுற்றத்தார் கண்ணே உள.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: Even when (a man's) property is all gone, relatives will act towards him with their accustomed (kindness).

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A man who has lost all his wealth ('பற்றற்ற கண்ணும்') is shown sitting alone amidst the ruins of his former prosperity. His fine clothes are now rags.
Layered_Composition.Midground: Despite his ruin, his true kinsmen ('சுற்றத்தார்') are approaching him not with scorn, but with warmth and compassion. They are bringing him food and offering a comforting hand, remembering their old relationship ('பழைமை பாராட்டுதல்').
Layered_Composition.Background: Fair-weather friends are shown walking away in the distance, emphasizing that only true kin remain in times of adversity.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: The unique quality of true kinsmen is that they continue to show affection and honor the old relationship, even when one has lost everything.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The contrast between the departing false friends and the approaching true family is key. The warm expressions of the family members show their unwavering affection.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The ruined man is in a somber, grey light. A warm, golden light surrounds the approaching family, symbolizing the hope and comfort they bring.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A medium shot focusing on the emotional reunion between the ruined man and his loyal family.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, with a strong focus on heartfelt facial expressions.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Symbolic lighting that contrasts despair with hope.
Technical_Cues.Art_Genre: Narrative realism, with a sentimental and emotional tone.
